notes: Midsize crossover SUV on GM U-platform shared with Pontiac Aztek. Three engine options through production: 3.4L V6 (2002-2003), 3.5L V6 (2004-2006), 3.6L V6 (2006-2007). FWD standard, AWD optional (Versatrak system). Third-row seating available. Discontinued after 2007 model year. Standard service complexity for 2000s midsize crossover. Data sourced from Wikipedia Buick Rendezvous article, December 19, 2024 revision.

Midsize SUV on GMT360 platform shared with Chevrolet TrailBlazer, GMC Envoy. RWD-based with optional AWD. Initially offered 4.2L Vortec inline-6 (2004-2005), later 5.3L V8 (2006-2007). Body-on-frame construction. Discontinued after 2007 model year. Standard service complexity for 2000s body-on-frame SUV. Data sourced from Wikipedia Buick Rainier article, December 19, 2024 revision.

Minivan on GM U-platform (long wheelbase) shared with Chevrolet Uplander, Pontiac Montana SV6, Saturn Relay. 3.5L V6 for 2005, upgraded to 3.9L V6 for 2006-2007. FWD standard, AWD optional. Discontinued after 2007 model year. Standard service complexity for 2000s minivan. Data sourced from Wikipedia Buick Terraza article, December 19, 2024 revision.

First generation full-size sedan replacing Century and Regal. GM W-platform. Base 3.8L V6 or optional 3.6L V6; high-performance Super model offered 5.3L V8 (2008-2009 only). FWD only. Standard service complexity for 2000s full-size sedan. Data sourced from Wikipedia Buick LaCrosse article, December 19, 2024 revision.

Full-size sedan replacing Park Avenue and LeSabre. GM G-platform (same as Cadillac DTS). Base 3.8L V6 (2006-2008) or 3.9L V6 (2009-2011); optional 4.6L Northstar V8 in Super trim. FWD only. Discontinued after 2011 model year. Standard service complexity for 2000s full-size sedan. Data sourced from Wikipedia Buick Lucerne article, December 19, 2024 revision.

First generation full-size crossover on GM Lambda platform shared with GMC Acadia, Chevrolet Traverse. 3.6L V6 initially 275 hp, upgraded to 288 hp with direct injection for 2009. 6-speed automatic transmission. FWD standard, AWD optional. Three-row seating. Standard service complexity for 2000s full-size crossover. Data sourced from Wikipedia Buick Enclave article, December 19, 2024 revision.
